alert.note: Alert for Choctaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 22 at 6:59PM CDT until further notice by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL CHOCTAW...NORTH CENTRAL WASHINGTON AND NORTHWESTERN CLARKE COUNTIES... At 659 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 4 miles southwest of Coffeeville, or 17 miles northeast of Chatom, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Choctaw, north central Washington and northwestern Clarke Counties. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
